properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 17 at 9:59AM MST until January 17 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Southern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming...

* Until 1100 AM MST.

* At 959 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along
Interstrate 80 near Cooper Cove, or 17 miles northwest of Laramie,
moving east at 30 mph.

HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts
greater than 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated and highway cameras.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

*

This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 285 and
320.

Locations impacted include...
Laramie, Bosler, Baldy Peak, University Of Wyoming War Memorial
Stadium, Lake Hattie Reservoir, The Buttes and Hutton Lake.
properties.instruction:
Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 11:00 AM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
